So hello everyone, today I will talk about the potential of targeting lipid droplets in breast cancer therapy.
So I'm sure that everyone here knows a woman or has a relative which has been diagnosed with breast cancer, which is the most common cancer in women.
And despite enormous efforts made in its prevention and therapy, remains one of the main cause of death.
Unlike infections where pathogen invasion leads to illness, cancer develops from our own cells only.
One mutated cell is needed to for cancer initiation and progression, and Moreover most aggressive tumors for metastasise and affect multiple tissues in our body.
Cancer cells share similar characteristics than healthy cells, but also include some modifications which help them grow and survive.
Fatty acids are lipids found in oils and fats and have two important roles.
Their precursors for energy production in inside the cells and also their building blocks for membrane synthesis.
Healthy cells have low lipid requirements and take fatty acids from food.
While cancer cells due to their high proliferation rates have higher lipid requirements, so they developed modifications which help them to survive and grow.
They are able to synthesize fatty acids interstellar, and they also take fatty acids from the surrounding tissues.
Fatty acids are interested are stored in lipid droplets.
These are unique organelles, found is most cells composed of natural core of triacylglycerols and cholesterol esters unbanded with phospholipid monolayer and proteins.
Several studies reported that cancers accumulate more lipid droplets than healthy tissues, so this is a hallmark of tomorrow, Genesis.

In our group, we are focused in study, the role of lipid droplets in breast cancer survival, and we found that breast cancer cells during starvation which have low amount of lipid droplets die during stress caused by starvation while breast cancer cells with high amount of lipid droplets displayed prolong survival.

We even found that severe starvation caused increased Additionally, increased lipid droplet formation in breast cancer cells and that we can target lipid droplet synthesis and degradation with different molecular tools and thereby Co affect the survival of these cells, so targeting lipid droplets is a possibility in cancer therapy.
